website_summaries.verdict: Hikers trust these affordable boots for their reliability and durability, even in tough weather.
pros: Rock-solid outsole provides excellent grip, even on slippery surfaces
cons: Occasional owner complaints about sizing differences

customer_reviews.title: You'll love these boots as long as you don't have to deal with Columbia
customer_reviews.text: These are great!! Lightweight but offer me the support I need. I like that they are a little wider to allow for a good hiking sock. They fit fine with regular socks but when I put them on with my favorite pair of hiking socks it was pure heaven!! ***Update*** I had a lace bracket on the top come out thus causing the boots to not be laced up properly. I contacted Columbia about this -since my boots were under warranty- and they said that I had to pay to send the boots to be repaired/replaced. Not happy about this solution as they are great boots.
customer_reviews.author: James Sartori

customer_reviews.title: Starting falling apart after five months
customer_reviews.text: These were mostly serviceable boots at first, although they were only vaguely waterproof. Walking in a pouring rain (but not through standing water), my feet would end up soaked because rain dripped off my pants and onto the fabric between the laces. I was okay with that, but was less impressed when one sole started falling off five months after purchase. Granted, I walk at least 15 miles per week, so that's about 300 miles. Still, I would have liked to get at least nine months out of these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Homesteader

customer_reviews.title: Light, well made, comfortable (but may run a little small)
customer_reviews.text: For a casual hiker (and someone who just found out he inherited a bleep-load of forest), these are terrific. They're light weight, well put together, and the treads are disturbingly 'catchy.' They're hiking boots, not work boots, so they probably won't handle a hunk of rebar being dropped on 'em, but on the other hand they weight a lot less -- so it's easier to run from bears. One note on size: I'm a 12-1/2 wide (in US size), so I ordered the 13 wide version. They fit perfectly, which tells me they run a teeny bit small. I'd order a half-size up and wear thicker socks if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kantor

customer_reviews.title: Good-looking, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say that I ordered my regular size (8.5 Medium) and had to return them because they were too small. But tha wasn't an issue because of Amazon's (new?) free-return-shipment through UPS Stores. I got a credit as soon as I dropped the 8.5s off to the store, and I got back on line to order the same boots in size 9. The new pair are great. They look very good, they fit well and feel comfortable, and they look as if they will allow for sure footing even on rough terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not good for winter wear.
customer_reviews.text: This was for my husband to have something to wear that was a little dressy (for him) in winter, aside from his work boots. It had good reviews and came in wide width. It fit him good but stopped wearing them after his bad experience. It was the deep of winter and very freezing temperatures and when he went into a store, the soles of the boots must have got too cold and lost all its traction. It was like walking on ice and had difficulty walking without slipping. I thought these were made for winter??? I’m so disappointed that we wasted our money. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Apples

customer_reviews.title: Great for tall people with big feet! Much better than Timberlands!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a size 15, so bought size 15 Timberland boots and they were WAY too tight on the sides. Exchanged it for a wide size and they were STILL too tight. My older brother (who's feet are bigger than mine) recommended buying Columbia brand boots because they have a wider fit, and sure enough, size 15 W Columbia boots fit great! Super comfy, space in the front for going down hill, took very little time to break in, durable, and waterproof. I recommend wearing liner socks and a pair of hiking wool socks together with these boots to have the most comfortable experience!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are nice boots but they are not wide
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 14 EEE so i bought the 14W. They are not wide at all. they dont even physically look wider than a standard shoe. Returned. Disappointed. The solid colored laces in the pictures are these boots. The brown/orange laces are the ones that I had to buy from somewhere else that ARE wide.
customer_reviews.author: Doogie

customer_reviews.title: Great boots.... not as wide as I'd hoped.
customer_reviews.text: I want to love these boots, and for the most part I do. They are very nicely made and overall very comfortable and warm. Length wise the sizing is right on. As for width I found them to be slightly narrow. Granted, this is my first pair of boots in a very long time. The right boot fits perfect. The left boot rubs on the side of my little toe just slightly. I wear them all day with very little discomfort. I only notice the rubbing if I'm walking a fair amount. Overall I think they are great boots and would buy again. I just wish they were a few millimeters wider.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Fisher

customer_reviews.title: All Around Great Boot!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for our Colorado trip, which was going to include a lot of outdoor activities-hiking, biking, rafting and the like. Once in Colorado, these boots performed well, lightweight and extremely durable. During one hike we crossed a small stream, while jumping from rock to rock the boots got wet but my feet didn't. The only time my socks got wet was when the water went over the top of the boot. And, even then they maintained good traction and dried fairly quickly. The boots don't show any signs of wear and tear, so I'm very happy with my purchase, -which by the way was an excellent price through amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not for even slightly wide feet.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of these in 14W since I have moderately wide feet (sometimes a D works depending on the cut of the shoe). I also ordered a pair of Rockport Men's Cold Springs Plus MC Toe in a 14D since a wide wasn't available and I wanted to try them both. Oddly I found the "W" Columbias to be narrow and uncomfortable, whereas the "D" Rockports fit perfectly. Too bad since I like the styling of the Columbias. They will have to go back to Amazon however.
customer_reviews.author: ctx1050

customer_reviews.title: The black ones look nice. Useful between buildings in Michigan winter and summer.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the looks and mentions of quality along with the fact that they were like the only ones with wides. On my ninth month with them and about time to replace. I walk about 21 miles per week between university buildings and wear these every day. The black is nice enough to wear with slacks. I do get a little stinky in the summer because they don’t breath at all. Not sure why the manufacturer could t have put in some venting. They aren’t particularly waterproof, but I proofed them myself. Because I have plantar fasciitis, I wear a custom orthotic in every shoe. Need wides to fit these.
customer_reviews.author: L. Segura

customer_reviews.title: My second pair in this color
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots for the price. They're not very breathable, but quite comfortable, so you may want to use them in cooler weather. Although they are not 100% waterproof (don't walk in standing water), they kept my feet dry in the rain. This is my second pair in this color and I've also ordered my second pair of black ones, I like them so much. My advice is that you keep some type of boot/leather conditioner on them. It took over a year, but both of my first two pairs cracked all over. I wish I had taken better care of them. I'm very happy to see they are still being sold.
customer_reviews.author: mugwally

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, good support, good grip and protection on rock fields.
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be honest, I wore these around for a few hours, and then climbed the Middle Teton in them. And yes I know how unwise it is to do some major hike like that in a brand new pair of boots, but my feet were in pretty dang good shape afterward. I had a spare pair of shoes in the bag just in case, but I did not need to swap over. Yes. A proper pair of hiking boots right here. I have wide feet and the wide width is what I ordered and received and succeeded in.
customer_reviews.author: Kierstena Rolfson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, waterproof, proper fit
customer_reviews.text: This is my. Fifth pair, I hike through tall wet grasS and woods daily They last 1-2 yrs for me I had tried several other brands including 180 dollar gortex boots and none were truly waterproof Just walking through the wet grass they would leak around tongue With these I can walk through the grass and even 4 inch deep water and stay completely dry I order 11 wide and that’s what I get, they are also light, comfortable and don’t make my feet sweat like the others So yes I recommend these boots
customer_reviews.author: tafster79

customer_reviews.title: Very light and great fit
customer_reviews.text: Generally, these are remarkably light and comfortable shoes with exceptionally effective grip. It snows and accumulates a lot of ice here (Northern Nevada), so good grip is important. One problem: the insoles feel as cushioning as old cardboard. Seriously. Bought some replacement insoles for $35 and fixed that problem, but it sure would be nice if proper insoles were part of the original product. Also improved the water resistance with spray from the shoe store... another $12. Sure wish that New Balance still offered the same model of old worn-out boots that have been relegated to yard work.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne H. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable straight out of the box, but sizing is off and tongue of the boot is too short
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable right of the box. The leather is broken in sufficiently so they do not feel stiff. Two things that were disappointing: one is that the fit was a half size too long, and the tongue of the boot is short, so that when you tie the laces you have to make sure the laces don’t slip up over the tongue. For the money, these are nice hiking boots, not the quality of Vasque or Merrill, but much less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: 2nd (/3rd) pair of boots, one had a defect
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair of these a few years ago and wore them constantly until I decided to stop wearing boots for a while...had no problems at all with my first pair. Ordered a second pair (I tossed my old boots a while ago...they needed replaced), but one of the eye "hooks" of one of the boots wasn't fully anchored and could rotate, meaning the base it was supposed to be secured to wasn't fully secure. I contacted Columbia, they recommended returning them, so I did. Amazon sent me a replacement pair, and haven't had any issues with the replacement pair.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Delay

customer_reviews.title: I had many boots to choose from. I'm glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.text: I started walking during the pandemic. I didn't want a athletic shoe because the last one ripped up during my walks. I have put in over 10,000 steps a day and these boots are still in great shape. I trusted that they would be durable because they were from Columbia. My walks are generally on pavement but they get some walking on grass surfaces also. Anyone doing a lot of walks should consider getting a tougher shoe instead of the flimsy athletic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: gv932n

customer_reviews.title: A good urban solution
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much exactly what I was looking for. Waterproof boot that is not too heavy, does not need a long break-in period, and comfortable enough that I can walk a couple miles on pavement. These are not much more than lightly insulated basketball shoes but compared to boots I've seen for twice the price, these seem like a pretty good value if I can get a couple seasons out of them. (Btw, I normally wear a 13 boot but that size in these seemed narrow. I ended up with a 12W that feels just right, with just enough room if I want to wear a thicker sock.)
customer_reviews.author: next

customer_reviews.title: Stay away! Worst boot ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is possiby the worst boot ever. Do not waste your money on this garbage. They aren't waterproof. They're cheaply glued together and break apart in less than 3 months. Save your money get better boots. Colombia also does not stand by their product and told me that after 3 months that it was co completely normal for the upper to break from the lower and I would need to pay to have them repaired. Never again
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: More grey than mud and a hard footbed.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 10.5 and 11 as I was uncertain of sizing and wanted to cover my bases. The 10.5 fit but there were two issues. First, the "mud" color I would describe as grey and I didn't find it very appealing. The shoe seemed well made and if the color was more brown it would have been better. As to fit and feel, the foot bed was almost non-existent and I could not imagine walking around in this boot for any length of time. i returned both pairs.
customer_reviews.author: xYEAGERx

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: To preface I wear a 9.5 and my feet are a bit wide. I've been hiking trails of a varieties and these shoes have performance awesome. Once they're broken in they feel perfect. My feel are very comfortable. The waterproofing is excellent, I've had nearly the whole foot submerged and my socks stayed dry. I've had zero blisters or sores. My feet just feel comfortable in them and I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, comfortable, and dry
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very lightweight and comfortable. I do a lot of walking on concrete and pavement, and I'm happy with the traction in wintry conditions. The only minor issue (so far) is that the tread can slip unpredictably on wet metal or tiled surfaces (this is an unfair comparison to the wet-surface grip of my Timberland Powertrain Sport Alloy Toe EH-M shoes, which are amazingly slip-resistant but NOT waterproof). I'm hoping wet-surface performance improves as the soles get roughed up a bit, but I'm quite satisfied with these boots just as they are.
customer_reviews.author: Pixeljockey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit 11W. 1 Year Update.
customer_reviews.text: Quick note. Great fit, comfortable. Open eyelets on top 2 is a solid choice, easy on & off due to that design. I have a large chunk of land in the Minnesota Northland. Will do an update on this in a year. Very happy with them on day 1. **April 2020** So they survived walking through the river, daily wear... Spring summer & Fall. I switched to snow boots in December. But attached these to my snowshoes. Needed a second pair of socks, but worked great to around -20° F. One eyelet bent open, closed it back w/ plyers & back in business. Washed in kitchen sink & dried upside-down in dish rack. Year two coming up!
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Uptown

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these boots brand new, and based on other reviews I decided to be extra cautious and used an additional waterproofing spray for boots/shoes, applied 2 layers as instructed, and waited 2 days before trying them out. On the walk to my car and on the way in from work in just a wet parking lot, my toes immediately got damp! Completely unacceptable, even with additional waterproofing these are so poorly made they aren't remotely waterproof. Will never buy a Columbia outdoor product again, extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: At the time of this review, I have worn my boots a majority of the time for work during the past 18 months. They have held up very well and are only showing signs of wear on the toe of the boots but are still very comfortable. I live in south Georgia and wear these during the summer months as well and my boots are never a problem for me. I wear a 9.5 shoe and the boots fit perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: HiTekRedNek

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: These boots seemed comfortable at first when I was walking around my house in them to break in little. But when I wore them on my first hike, the tongue of the boots was very stiff that it kept rubbing on my upper ankle area. After my hike my lower legs were in bad pain that I had to wear these laced up half way just to finish the hike. When I was finally able to take them off, I saw that my lower leg/ankle areas were swollen. Very disappointing as they were a very nice style. I’ll give it a try one more time for next hike but as of now these are okay for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: These boots do NOT last very long
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for hiking. They are comfortable and sturdy. The started falling apart in less than 100 miles of hiking. The sole started coming apart from the boot, the toe rubber started falling off and the lace guides started bending back. Sent them back to factory for warranty repair in 10 months of use and they issued credit for the boots. Do not recommend these boots.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am the type of person that does not like buying shoes I cannot try on first; however, I know that Columbia is a top brand (that is reasonably priced) so I decide to give it a go! Getting outdoors again, and considering camping and hiking again boots for the occasion were a must. These are very comfortable and I can wear them all day (fresh out of the box) without feeling like my feet are falling asleep, or fatigued in any way. They worked great for me!
customer_reviews.author: Cory A Damme

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Even though these are hiking boots I am using them as work boots. I work as a building manager and needed something that holds up to concrete floors for part of the day but then something that I could wear to do landscaping for another part of the day. These looked good but felt better. They are easy to clean, kept my feet dry while shoving snow and feel comfortable, no break in period needed. I will admit that I do use my own inserts and only tried the ones in the shoe for a few days... nothing wrong with the ones that came in the shoe just have a brand I like and trust. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots that really are waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I got these Friday night and went on a 10 mile hike early Saturday morning. These boots worked great on the hike! There was quite a bit of mud and some water, but the kept my feet completely dry without getting hot. After getting home I used the hose and a brush and they came completely clean. I'm very happy with them so far. Will update if they have problems.
customer_reviews.author: RPB

customer_reviews.title: Yip!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted and needed for my mountain hikes and work. Fit was perfect 11 as ordered. Nice looking in an underplayed way...actually look better after they get a little dirt on them. I know, why talk about how they look get to how they feel. Okay, since you asked, they felt like putting on comfortable sneakers but with strong support. I need extra support in the ankles and these responded nicely. Not that expensive, nice understated look, and instant comfort. Were they what I wanted..."Yip!"
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Creek Golf

customer_reviews.title: WATERPROOF BOOTS THAT FEEL COMFY AS A TENNIS SHOE
customer_reviews.text: Well...at first I was trying to find a 12.5 size, but the 12 fits with a thinner sock...COLUMBIA is a GREAT BRAND and is of SOLID construction. This boot is WATERPROOF, and will definitely serve me well during the thunderstorms during a cloudy Christmas Day which we are expecting 2" of RAIN
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Susman

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for the money, super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. Very light and comfortable. The waterproof feature is handy in rainy weather. Doesn’t feel like a typical bulky boot. Fits almost like a sneaker. My only complaint is they mark up easily, but I chose them for function over form. Columbia always makes a great shoe. Very comfortable and well made. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: MadMan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trek to Annapurna Base Camp. Worked perfectly even though I did not get a chance to break them in before the trip. The grips at the bottom is ideal for the constantly changing terrain and it protected well against water. The only negative thing I noticed is that IT WILL SLIDE on flat wet rocks/slabs so be very very careful when stepping on those. Overall, a great pair of hiking boots which i highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: BigTime

customer_reviews.title: Extra extra small width
customer_reviews.text: Super narrow shoes - I bought the wide version and I couldn’t even get my foot in
customer_reviews.author: Colton

customer_reviews.title: This Columbia was a Bit too Snug
customer_reviews.text: I found this boot fits slightly smaller and tighter than my normal shoe size of 9E. Although the Columbia Newton Ridge Plus II WP Wide hiking boot is advertised as "wide", it didn't fit like a wide boot. I wanted to enjoy this boot as it received very high ratings, but had to return it and select another boot with a 9EE size. Overall, the construction seemed very well built which would accommodate a narrower foot.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick P.

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit.  The wide is  like regular.
customer_reviews.text: Great boots so far. Just breaking them in first day. They fit a bit small. I wear 11 wide all my shoes and hiking boots 12 Wide. This 12 wide is more like 11.5 . The insert is same as my 11 W dress shoes. Unfortunately they are not available in x-wide. Go on the larger side. Will update the post in two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: mirek60

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband and he wears them daily. He said they are comfortable, although it took a few days to break them in so they weren’t stiff. He hasn’t had any issues with his feet getting wet but he also doesn’t stay out in the wet. We’ve had them a few years now and they are still holding up just fine. He wears a size 12 and bought a 12 and they fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: VERY cheap material!!!
customer_reviews.text: I pressure wash exterior homes so waterproof boots is a must. These boots were awesome, but only for the first month. Later on, the soles began to detach and a lot of water began to seep through the inside of my boots. The otter layer of the boots also started to break down. As you can see in the pictures, you can see why I may not get these boot again.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Not for very cold weather or long wear
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable Fits small Rigid Not much cushioning Best work on natural paths and not concrete They are waterproof but I hesitate to wear as after a brief period of wear they hurt They are not warm either so why keep them They are now my gardening boots so they are in their element Not for long periods of wear or cold weather
customer_reviews.author: reader one

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I've just about worn out my Columbia Razor Ridge boots and need a new pair. I'm a big fan of Columbia boots, but not sure what to do as finding a good fit on-line seems to be problematic. Hard to believe these Newton Ridge boots are 2E width, they are much more narrow than anything I would describe as wide. Length is sort of ok. There is a very uncomfortable and noticeable hump or bump in the area directly behind the toe area. Since I don't see that unfavorable description anywhere in the reviews for this boot, I must assume the shape of my foot is different.
customer_reviews.author: KKD

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, does not last
customer_reviews.text: These took about 2 days to break in, but after that, they fit really well and are very comfortable. I usually have a hard time finding shoes that don't make my feet hurt. These were great, but they started falling apart pretty quickly. First one of the "lugs" came off, right along the edge where the flat bottom meets the curved side of the sole. It's now been about 4 months, and the shoes are pretty much totally worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great boots overall
customer_reviews.text: Overall they're great boots. They fit true to size unlike some others and are very comfortable. Definitely waterproof and dry easily after. They're lightweight and slip on/off easily. Even though they dont say wide a wide foot (or swollen) still easily fits. Our only and biggest complaint was that one of the hooks to loop the lace around has already pulled out after less than a month of everyday wear.
customer_reviews.author: Christi G

customer_reviews.title: Adequate but with drawbacks.
customer_reviews.text: I feel i should add, I'm around 200 pounds and carried a 30 pound pack on my first outting with these shoes. They were just comfortable enough for a day of hiking in light, moderate terrain. The heal did give me a blister, will try thicker socks next time. If there was any less tread or sole material i would be feeling every rock. This is a very very light duty hiking shoe. Any 3+ day adventure with a heavier pack and rougher terrain, I would choose another boot. No hate on Columbia as I love their shirts and pants but i couldnt come to love these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not really wide
customer_reviews.text: Previous boots made by Columbia have been exceptional. These were too narrow in the toe causing my big toe to rub against the inside or the boot causing pain. Couldn’t tolerate them for long. I sent them back. I want to build a brand of comfortable wide toe foot ware. Birkenstock (wide toe and cork sole) meets Dr. Martin (airwalk) meets Crocs. Turns out wide is not that wide.
customer_reviews.author: RPepper

customer_reviews.title: Second pair fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: I take a size 10 in most boots and my last pair of Columbia boots was also a 10 - but the first set of these I bought were too small (toes hit the end of the boot) and a bit too narrow. After I exchanged for the 10.5W, they fit very well and will be an awesome winter boot. Since they're leather, I'd recommend using some mink oil on them to increase waterproofing and keep the leather nice over time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen S.

customer_reviews.title: Digs into the heel.
customer_reviews.text: The shoe was a bit too tight on my feet even for the wide shoe though for hiking I didnt mind that it too much and figured I just needed to break them in to loosen them up but first time wearing them out they cut into my heels and made them hard to wear, hiked for less than 2 miles and by the time I got back to camp I couldnt wait to get them off. Returning them and going with a different brand
customer_reviews.author: Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Hurt!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these so bad. I tried them out on a really short hike, and by the end, my ankles were shredded and bleeding. So uncomfortable! The left one fit way differently than the right one, so I had to put an insole only in the left one. I would have returned them if they weren't filled with my blood.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Kept my feet dry in all day rain and were very comfortable but don't last, not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.text: Kept my feet dry in all day rain and were very comfortable. Tread wore out incredibly quick. The first day wearing them the end of one of the shoelaces came off leaving a white cotton puff on the end. 3 months later the outside seam near the toes have busted open on BOTH shoes. The shoes are not too tight so I'm assuming it's not my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: The best hikers I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I like wearing hikers in the fall and also in the winter too. They look good. They are a bit on the narrow side. To me the wide with is normal width. I put some Dr. Scholls work insoles in them and now they're very comfy. They're much more comfortable than the other hiker I've had in the past. I really like Columbia and will buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: I've wore these boots all winter and they have worked out fine. They are waterproof so far. They also have given me security by having great traction. The only complaint I have is the shoe strings are to thin and won't stayed tied without a double knot. I replaced them the second week I had the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable all day support
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. The most comfortable hiking boot I have ever owned. Great tread, ankle support, laces stay tied all day. Attractive and well built. Buying a 2nd pair after 4 months just in case they are discontinued before these wear out. Update: the pic shows 6 mos hard all day wear. I crawl through attics and under houses wearing these and will never buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great first pair of boots
customer_reviews.text: Only took a couple hikes in them. But they fit very nicely. Don't feel too heavy, and are sturdy but flexible, if that makes sense. I have a bad ankle, but it felt protected without being too stiff. They felt pretty decent in terms of keeping my feet cool, but i don't believe these are allowed to be considered 'breathable'. Guess we'll see what the fall/winter holds
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Bummer and disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These lasted for 3 average length hikes before breaking at the top of the lace. Doesn't seem to be real Columbia quality. Incredibly disappointing in addition to a cranky teenager upset his hiking boots failed.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna Orsborn

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: The boots fit very well with good support for light hiker. However after only having the boots for less than 4 months and not really put many miles on them and very little weather the sole suddenly started pulling away from the boot today... Hoping I can get a replacement with out a lot hassle. Even at the moderate price I still expect that I should get 9-12 months out of these. This was my first time ordering this brand and it may be last. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Jensen

customer_reviews.title: It fits!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing 2 other pairs of shoes over the last year from Amazon I was really hesitant to order yet another pair. The previous pairs of shoes that I had ordered were not size 13 and were probably a size and a 1/2 too small. I was pleasantly surprised to find that this was indeed a real size 13 shoe! I swear some shoe manufacturers are trying to boost the egos of people with tiny feet to the suffering of us big guys.
customer_reviews.author: Saimei Kinjo

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband is on his feet most of the day, usually 14 to 16 hours and I have bought so many brands with good ratings and there is always something wrong. Tried these and he said the first day he put them on that they felt great... That was a plus, then after a week of using them he said his feet felt great. 5 STARs for this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: 16Paws

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to really torture these boots, but I've walked two miles in them so far just to break them in a bit and get a feel for them, and they're extremely comfortable. They feel very sturdy, the soles are thick, and they provide a little ankle support without being constricting. Love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: SA7

customer_reviews.title: Initial Impression
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it but from trying it on and from my visual analysis, it's a fantastic product. Super comfy for the short duration of my quick test. Will give my full review once I take my trip to Iceland. Even though I haven't put it to the test, I'm still inclined to recommend it, as these seem well put together. I'm confident it will exceed my expectations. I haven't gotten a boot this sharp looking and light before, especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Great boot.
customer_reviews.text: My husband had two pair of these. This is his third pair. First pair is everyday work boot. Waterproof and comfortable hardworking boot. Bought a second pair for hunting. This recent purchase is for casual wear. They're a good looking all- around boot.
customer_reviews.author: georgiapeach

customer_reviews.title: About to order another pair!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. My foot is actually a 12 but the 11.5 I ordered by mistake fits with no socks or thin socks. Durable. I just stepped in two mouse traps in a rental unit so I need to order another pair since these are getting worn anyway. Had a screw get stuck in the bottom but didn't come close to penetrating the sole. I trust these on the construction site. Very comfy too for a quick hike on my days off.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar B Cabarcas

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes; Cheap Laces
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a couple of weeks ago. Always had good success with Columbia brand products. These shoes are super comfortable, however, only after a few wears, the laces are beginning to fray. I don’t think they’ll last much longer. I wish Columbia would’ve used eyelet holes all the way to the top to make tying easier. Overall a good shoe but I wouldn’t buy them anymore due to the poor quality of the laces.
customer_reviews.author: David R

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow and poorly put together.
customer_reviews.text: First off, don’t get these. I went out once in them. I didn’t even go hiking. I wore them around the camp and they have started to open up on the inside of my foot at the seams. Where the rubber meets the leather, already ripping off. Second off, if you’re still set on getting these for whatever reason, get the wide size. I don’t have a wide foot and these are much too narrow. Thanks to their bologna return policy I can’t return them either. I will not be buying anymore shoes from Columbia.
customer_reviews.author: Jake McCormick

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've been through just about every brand of boots known. from 35$ to 400$ these are the most comfortable boots right out of the box. It feels like I'm wearing my favorite slippers. Not sure how well the will last which is the biggest problem I have being a Land Surveyor I can walk anywhere from 2 to 10 miles in a day. we shall see. they are rather soft on the bottom so I don't expect long but for the price if I can get 6 months out of them it will be worth it. I do have a heavier pair of boots I wear on construction. They are the Caterpillar brand and they are also very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: I just had to return a pair of Merrel hiking boots because the size was not as expected and the comfort was minimal at best. I then bought these instead and was surprised by how much more comfortable these were than Merrel. Also, the Merrel boots were $15 more. than these WITHOUT free returns (Cost me $14 to return Merrel boots). Anyways, best boots that you can buy for under $70 easily. I have wide feet so I had to buy the 14W.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot! Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love this boot! I bought them specifically because of a trip to Acadia National Park where we did some pretty intense hiking. I put around 25 miles on them in a few days. These were very comfortable, almost forgot they were on my feet. They are super grippy, especially on rocks. They even somewhat had to serve as a climbing shoe and helped a lot in that regard. I can't recommend them enough at this price point. I did not get to test them out with water resistance, but they did well in mud.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan king

customer_reviews.title: Good style and comfort but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fit and style. The problem is my new boots I have barely worn is I went to pull the shoestring around the top left boot metal support and it just popped out. That basically makes the left boot frustrating to work with and reflects on durability. Want to give these boots a higher rating but I didn’t buy them for style and comfort alone. I expect them to be durable and last with normal use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great boots but run small
customer_reviews.text: Although for the most part they are wonderful, they are just too tight for my feet. I ordered the wide size thinking that they would fit but I could not even get them on unless I had no socks or very thin socks on. I recommend them for anyone who does not have wide feet. Even if they ever carry extra wide sizes (4ee) i will try them again.
customer_reviews.author: cranky old man

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes.  Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my bf. When received, we were delighted to find out that the description was true, they were as same as pic., and bright colors, but when he tried them on it was a bit narrow on the sides, although the length fitted perfectly. All in all he would have to walk a little more in these shoes in order to take the final opinion, but we have some hope that the shoes will get a little wider with time.
customer_reviews.author: nina

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and supportive.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a gift for my son. He loves them. He wanted the higher height as he has severe pronation and needs ankle support. Good color choice, the light gray. Boots seem sturdy, we’ll see how they hold up, he hikes weekly.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Black Unger

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good shoes that lasted about 15 months of daily wear
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes pretty much daily for about 15 months, until they eventually wore out. They were comfortable to wear and the waterproofing worked pretty well until near the end. After 15 months of wear, one of the problems included the shoelace hooks at the top getting bent inward toward the shoe, and eventually, after repeatedly bending them back out so I could unhook the laces, one of the hooks actually snapped off due to metal fatigue. The black part of the soles actually wore completely through in several places to the softer brown portion. Finally, the soles separated from the shoe at the toe end, at which point the waterproofing failed completely.
customer_reviews.author: C. George

customer_reviews.title: No half sizes offered makes choosing one's size a risk of having to return shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Size 11 US rather than 12 was ordered and received knowing there was a chance of necessitating a return. The fit is slightly smaller than preferred whereas a size 12 would likely have been too large. Because the shoe overall is of good quality for the price and the fit is okay, I am keeping them.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis McDonough

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for two pairs.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a pair of these and returned them for a replacement because one of the boots had a loud squeaking sound. Received the second pair and after only 6 months the sole is separating on one of them. I have had Columbia boots in the past and never had an issue with them but after this I will probably buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great great boot for the price! I just hiked the 2nd hardest hike in America. Just under 27 miles in 15hrs in these boots. NOT 1 BLISTER & my feet felt fine afterwards! Grand Canyon Bright Angel to North Kaibab.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Solid boot
customer_reviews.text: I wear this boot daily during the winter. This is my second pair. So far it has lasted me two winters... first pair got me 3 before the lining wore out... I live in Minnesota and we have long harsh winters and wearing them daily I feel like they take a beating pretty well and last a long time for the use they get.
customer_reviews.author: Leif T Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Update think about it
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots this was my 3rd time buying them. I remember my first two pair lasting a lot longer. January 2020 I started to wear these boots. Here is a six month update. Not worth the $92 it cost to get them. The soles are completely worn down and the leather is peeling off after a few months of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Shainna

customer_reviews.title: WIDE WIDTH IS NOT WIDE AT ALL!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband. I ordered his size in Wide and it came marked that size, but he could barely get his foot into the boot. These are NOT WIDE WIDTH boots!!! In fact they looked narrower than normal size widths. If you wear a wide or extra wide shoe, do not buy these. It's too bad, because they're a nice looking boot and my husband really liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped the Newton Ridge Plus II boots would be similar to my 12-year-old Columbia Icetrel II boots. They were not. Even though I ordered a 9.5 wide, the Newton Ridge was narrower than the Icetrel 9.5 regular, plus it was longer, so the fit was unacceptable. The quality of the shoe was also inferior to that of the Icetrel.
customer_reviews.author: David Gunn

customer_reviews.title: Tread is too soft!
customer_reviews.text: Once I received these boots, they looked great but the tread was constructed too soft and it would have worn out too quickly! I returned them immediately the very next day! Had they been constructed with harder or tougher tread I would have kept them but I knew it was going to wear quickly! Once I was refunded I spent a bit more and went with Timberlands waterproof boots to last a lot longer! Columbia .... please construct tougher tread and consumers would be much happier and wouldn't have to return them, just saying!
customer_reviews.author: Masoud

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've only worn a couple of times so far but I can tell they'll break in easy. Seem to be well made and I really like the look, a bit of a doc Martin vibe except it's a sneaker! Happy with the purchase and the price. I'm 6' 4" and 300 lbs so a comfortable shoe that can take the weight is a must.
customer_reviews.author: John L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Runs small.  My grade C.
customer_reviews.text: Needs a little more cushioning at heel and toe. Tongue should be more substantial. Too narrow at front area of boot, heel width OK. Shoe very uncomfortable with thick Winter sock. Bottom of soul color is khaki not copper as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: IRH

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable boots I've ever worn. Waterproof and light. Bought an extra pair.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: These blue ones not a true “wide” shoe
customer_reviews.text: For a “wide” fit shoe, it’s pretty narrow. Love the color and style of it, which is why I kept it, but my feet will def suffer a bit. Had other “wide” fit Columbia newton ridge shoes and they were a more wide shoe, which tells me that they no doubt mfg these in different places. Overall do like the look just wish they were a true wide shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Pathetic Bills Fan

customer_reviews.title: Good Boots reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected lite, waterproof and warm, can't find anything to fault after 14 days daily use ( 8-14 hours a day walking up to 7-9 miles a day, at 14,000-19,000 steps a day) use in rain snow and on ice( mostly urban pavement). wish they had better color choices in my size 12 wide. Compaired to my old Danner high tops about half the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar L. Cox Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite pair of hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I have to wade through water at times and these things are great! Whenever I run through a pair (about a year each) I buy another pair. My favorite boots. Being waterproof your feet will sweat in these so if you have an issue with that might want to go the non waterproof route. My highest recommendation for these awesome hiking boots though.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J Brown

customer_reviews.title: Reliable light boot
customer_reviews.text: Third pair over 6 years. Seems the newer ones are narrower so I went up a half size and ordered the wide version. Good for city wear and day hiking. Pretty durable. New one has a matte finish that makes the leather harder to clean so a good old fashioned polishing works wonders.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mclain

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable, but not great
customer_reviews.text: The Columbia boots look like plastic on the outside. They're fine, but not real comfortable. I suggest spending a little extra for the Keen Targhee II Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot. I have had two pair of the Keens and they are a much better built, longer-wearing product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Benz

customer_reviews.title: Very nice boots... comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very Nice! They are light weight and very comfortable. They fit perfectly too! Boot seems well made, put some mink oil on them to make sure they were water proof.. Will see when I am out in a rain soaked field if they truly are water proof.. Will definately re vamp my review if they are not!
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: Great product and well made.
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered a 11 medium width which is my normal shoe size. These definitely run narrow so I returned them for a 11 wide. These fit perfectly and are very comfortable. I used these on a trip to Mexico as my only shoes. I laid floor tile for 5 days and these shoes are light and very comfortable. The short term prognosis is these are a great product. I will have to see how they are in the long run and regarding how waterproof they are.
customer_reviews.author: BillyJoeBob

customer_reviews.title: The best hiking boot.
customer_reviews.text: The best hiking boot i have found. Better than Merrell or Timberland but the laces won't stay tied on the all black style wheras they did on the blk/brown style. Don't mind doubling the knot though.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like nicely made boots but even though I ordered a wide size, they still seemed a bit tight. I'm on my feet a lot and did not want to take a chance that they might loosen up. That said, my issues with my feet are my issues. They might be great for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a trail hiking boot.
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof, yes. Traction, yes. Ankle support, none. This would be a good hiker for around town or paved trails. It has no ankle support. Also very little cushioning in sole. After a few miles you feel every rock. Would not recommend for trail conditions. Will be manageable for work in the field so not a total loss.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Messina

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot, Sizing Way Small
customer_reviews.text: I've worn size 12 for decades. A 12 Wide was much too small. I exchanged for 13 wide and it's a very comfortable fit with the flexibility to "snug it up" a bit using the laces. Like other reviews, add a size and start from there.
customer_reviews.author: Driller

customer_reviews.title: needs to be broke in
customer_reviews.text: just tried them on and fit is pretty good, maybe even a bit big. i wear a 9.5W and this has a little room left in the toes where i could even maybe get away with a 9w but they are pretty stiff. will update after i get some miles on them
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: Very bad shipping with prime  GET WIDE
customer_reviews.text: Took over a week to get here due to the virus. Thats understandable but when the package arrived the box seemed to be punched or stabbed with something. The shoes inside were fine and I like the fit of the shoes. Get a wide
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: Breaks down too fast but comfortable boot.
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and not much time needed to break in. However, around 2 to 3 months the boots lose their ability to remain waterproof. I've bought a few pairs and this seems to be an issue with whatever materials they use to construct the boot. For that reason, I feel the boot is overpriced. If waterproofing lasted for at least 6 months then it would be fairly priced.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny C

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Hiking Shoes That Get The Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed these shoes for hiking up in the mountains of northern New Mexico. They are light weight and also added a decent amount of waterproof protection for crossing some streams and other wetland areas.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Where's the padding?
customer_reviews.text: Just like most shoes and boots now, there is not enough padding in the sole. You walk on a plastic, stiff sole. Why did everyone get away from putting padding in the soles of shoes like when we were kids? Feet hurt by the end of day, feel bruised. and no i am not overweight, 6'2" 180 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: shadowhunter

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost!  They wear out in 4 months!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second and last pair purchased within a year. Both pairs wore thru from the inside out. The upper material above the toe is so thin that your toe wears thru the foam then splits the upper material. Very disappointed in the quality of this boot. Going back to Timberland boots.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S

product_meta.title: Columbia Men's Newton Ridge Plus Ii Waterproof Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Rich, all-over leather gives a premium outdoor feel to this supportive, waterproof hiking boot. The newton ridge plus waterproof seals out wet weather while also breathing and features a shank under the arch, delivering stability and support where you need it and flexibility where you don’t. The Omni grip® rubber outsole features rugged, grippy traction specifically designed to evacuate mud.
feature_bullets: Waterproof mixed-materials boot featuring D-ring lacing with speed hooks on shaft and mesh tongue with logo patch
Techlite lightweight midsole for comfort and high energy return
